sentences.english: If in capture wind clear rain and dew natural environment peony's sentiment condition .
sentences.chinese: 如捕捉風晴雨露自然環境中牡丹的情態。

sentences.english: Modals go in front of the subject in questions.
sentences.chinese: 情態動詞置於主語之前構成疑問句。

sentences.english: Pursue superlative modal verb, ideal blend often.
sentences.chinese: 追求最高級，理想常融情態動詞。

sentences.english: The paper deals with the function of modal particles in modal category.
sentences.chinese: 本文討論情態語氣範疇中語氣詞的功能問題。

sentences.english: You use negative words with modals to make negative clauses.
sentences.chinese: 情態動詞與否定詞連用可構成否定句。

sentences.english: Contextual and situational factors must be taken into account in using and understanding modals.
sentences.chinese: 理解和使用情態動詞，必須考慮語境因素。

sentences.english: You never use two modals together.
sentences.chinese: 兩個情態動詞不能同時使用。

sentences.english: This is a difference between Chinese and English categorial grammar.
sentences.chinese: 情態是人類語言中一個重要的語法範疇。

sentences.english: The determined meaning of the structure matches the modality meaning of ta.
sentences.chinese: 句式的決心義與“他”預指時的情態義相互匹配。

sentences.english: Different scholars have made different classifications of modality .
sentences.chinese: 不同學者對於情態的分類也不同。

sentences.english: Modals are always the first word in a verb group.
sentences.chinese: 情態動詞總是出現在動詞短語中的第一位。

sentences.english: He required his painters to draw inspiration from nature and grasp both the subject's image and inner world.
sentences.chinese: 他要求畫家要師法自然，把握對象的“情態形色”。

sentences.english: In Hallidayan tradition, interpersonal function is mainly realized by mood system, modality system, attitudinal epithets, comment adjuncts, vocatives etc.
sentences.chinese: 他提出人際功能主要是由語氣和情態系統實現的。
情態動詞只有一種形式。

definition: (of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to put on an attitude/to pose
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
a transition (stop and change) in spoken sound, music or in brush strokes/a cadence/punctuated by a transition/with syncopated cadence (brush stroke in painting)
in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
